description: Commands to manage ingress and traffic-splitting.

commands.name: az containerapp ingress disable
commands.summary: Disable ingress for a container app.
examples: az containerapp ingress disable -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az containerapp ingress enable
commands.summary: Enable or update ingress for a container app.
commands.syntax:
az containerapp ingress enable --type {external, internal}
                               [--allow-insecure {false, true}]
                               [--exposed-port]
                               [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--target-port]
                               [--transport {auto, http, http2, tcp}]
examples:
az containerapp ingress enable -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup \
    --type external --allow-insecure --target-port 80 --transport auto

commands.name: az containerapp ingress show
commands.summary: Show details of a container app's ingress.
examples: az containerapp ingress show -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az containerapp ingress update
commands.summary: Update ingress for a container app.
commands.syntax:
az containerapp ingress update [--allow-insecure {false, true}]
                               [--exposed-port]
                               [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--target-port]
                               [--transport {auto, http, http2, tcp}]
                               [--type {external, internal}]
examples:
az containerapp ingress update -n my-containerapp -g MyResourceGroup \
    --target-port 8080
